subject: RE: [junit] how to implement java with the junit
msgSnippet: Hi Annie, 1. Cut and paste the following code in a file called StringTest.java ... import junit.framework.TestCase; import junit.framework.Test; import
messageBody:
RE: [junit] how to implement java with the junit

Hi Annie,

1. Cut and paste the following code in a file called StringTest.java
------------
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import junit.framework.Test;
import junit.framework.TestSuite;

public class StringTest extends TestCase {

  public StringTest(String arg) { super(arg);}

  public void testSimpleCompare() {
    String a = "a";
    String b = "b";

    assert(!a.equals(b));
  }

  public static Test suite() {
    TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
    suite.addTest( new StringTest("testSimpleCompare") );
    return suite;
  }
}
-------------
2. Compile StringTest.java
3. Run java junit.textui.TestRunner StringTest

Thanks,
Eugene
-----Original Message-----
From: Annie Chong
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: 4/13/2001 10:28 AM
Subject: [junit] how to implement java with the junit

dear members,
 for this few days, i try to go trough what is junit
actually but i still dun know how to implement the
java program with the junit together. hope that u all
can help me to solve the problem. thanks
